definition: to be in debt/to incur debts/liability (finance)
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
to owe a debt/the sum owed
to raise a loan/to borrow money

sentences.chinese: 許願就是債，欠了不容賴。

sentences.english: This thing but proof of red of You Yanguo prince, adjure a help I am chased after return this debt.
sentences.chinese: 這件事可由燕國太子丹證明，懇請幫助我追還這筆債。

sentences.english: Shanghai i Securities News reported, to combat escaped and revoked debts has become an important task for the current banking industry.
sentences.chinese: 上證報消息，打擊逃廢債已成當前銀行業的重要任務。

sentences.english: Debt collectors buy old debts from companies or lenders for pennies on the dollar.
sentences.chinese: 債主從公司收舊賬或者跟債務人討小錢。

sentences.english: Start by figuring out exactly how much you owe, and decide what you're going to tackle first.
sentences.chinese: 先算清自己到底欠了多少債，然後想辦法去解決。

sentences.english: Within bonds, we overweight credit versus underweight government bonds.
sentences.chinese: 具體而言，我們繼續相對看好企業債，看空政府債。

sentences.english: I had expected the ring finger of the love, but it is the feeling or debt.
sentences.chinese: 我曾期望無名指的愛，卻不知它是情還是債。
許願就是債，欠了不容賴。

sentences.english: He is shouldering heavy debt for his child's education.
sentences.chinese: 爲了讓孩子受教育，他身負重債。

sentences.english: She couldn't pay her debt; instead she told me a cock and bull story about having been robbed.
sentences.chinese: 她還不了債，遂編了個彌天大謊騙我說她遭劫了。

sentences.english: They have a significant amount of debt.
sentences.chinese: 他們欠了相當大的一筆債。

sentences.english: He contracted a large sum of debt to get his child educated.
sentences.chinese: 爲了讓孩子受教育，他身負重債。

sentences.english: XiaoMin mother continuously like playing CARDS, owes a lot of betting debts.
sentences.chinese: 小敏的媽媽不斷喜歡玩牌賭錢，欠下了不少債。

sentences.english: Says the love is a debt which owes.
Because of my debts, I was starting from below zero.
sentences.chinese: 因爲欠了一身債，我又要從零開始。

sentences.english: He was heavily in debt in order to get his children be educated.
sentences.chinese: 爲了讓孩子受教育，他身負重債。

definition: to lend on interest/to borrow/a loan/leniency/to make excuses/to pardon/to forgive
a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to repay/to compensate for/to recompense/to fulfill (hopes etc)
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
